    Check that a data frame contains columns and fields specified in mapping

    is_mapping_valid.Rd

    Check that a data frame contains columns and fields specified in mapping

    is_mapping_valid(
  df,
  mapping,
  vRequiredParams = NULL,
  bKeepAllParams = FALSE,
  vUniqueCols = NULL,
  vNACols = NULL,
  bQuiet = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    df

    data.frame to compare to mapping object.

    mapping

    named list specifying expected columns and fields in df.

    vRequiredParams

    character vector of names that must be present in mapping.

    bKeepAllParams

    Should params not included in vRequiredParams be evaluated? Default is false.

    vUniqueCols

    list of columns expected to be unique. default = NULL (none).

    vNACols

    list of columns where na values are acceptable default = NULL (none).

    bQuiet

    Default is TRUE, which means warning messages are suppressed. Set to FALSE to see warning messages.

    Examples

    subj_mapping <- list(strIDCol = "SubjectID",
                    strSiteCol = "SiteID",
                    strExposureCol = "TimeOnTreatment")

is_mapping_valid(df = clindata::rawplus_subj,
                 mapping = subj_mapping,
                 vUniqueCols = "SUBJID",
                 vRequiredParams = c("strIDCol", "strSiteCol", "strExposureCol"))
#> $status
#> [1] TRUE
#>

subj_mapping$not_a_col <- "nope"

is_mapping_valid(df = clindata::rawplus_subj,
                 mapping = subj_mapping,
                 vUniqueCols = "SUBJID",
                 vRequiredParams = c("strIDCol", "strSiteCol", "strExposureCol"))
